snippet: Eliot Spitzer, the former New York governor, wants to run for city comptroller, but he needs 3,750 signatures by the end of Thursday to get on the ballot.
abstract: Eliot Spitzer’s improbable return to New York politics, for office of city comptroller,  depends on whether he can collect at least 3,750 valid signatures by the end of July 11 to qualify for September primary;  he faces a public ambivalent about his desire to return to government five years after scandal forced him from office.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ

lead_paragraph: Eliot Spitzer, the former New York governor, wants to run for city comptroller, but he needs 3,750 signatures by the end of Thursday to get on the ballot.

headline.main: Spitzer’s First Challenge Is Collecting Signatures
headline.print_headline: Spitzer’s First Challenge Is Collecting Signatures
